item.title: Download and Install the Water Health and Economic Analysis Tool for Your Water Utility
item.description:
The quick reference guide explains how to:

  • Download and install Version 3.0 of the Water Health and Economic Analysis Tool (WHEAT)
  • Navigate the tool
  • Quick Reference Guide WHEAT Version 3.0 (PDF)(6 pp, 1 MB, 817-F-14-004)
item.dc:creator: gjasmin

item.title: Learn How to Identify Health and Economic Impacts from Water Utility Emergencies
item.description:
This fact sheet outlines the process used by the Water Health and Economic Analysis Tool to determine health and economic impacts for water utilities faced with:

  • Loss of one or more assets
  • Release of a hazardous gas
  • Intentional drinking water contamination
  • Water Health and Economic Analysis Tool Version 3.0 (PDF)(2 pp, 464 K, EPA 817-F-14-003)
item.dc:creator: gjasmin

item.title: Find Out About Health and Economic Impacts from Water Utility Emergencies
item.description:
On this page:
  • About the Water Health and Economic Analysis Tool (WHEAT)
  • Download WHEAT
  • System requirements
  • To install WHEAT

Water Health and Economic Analysis Tool (WHEAT) 3.0

EPA created this tool to:

  • Provide drinking water and wastewater utilities with likely health and economic outcomes
  • Offer a detailed consequence analysis

WHEAT analyzes consequences for:

  • Loss of one or more assets
  • Release of a hazardous gas 
  • Intentional drinking water contamination 

 

Top of Page

Learn more about WHEAT

  • WHEAT Version 3.0 fact sheet
  • WHEAT Version 3.0: Quick Reference Guide

Top of Page

​

System requirements

The system requirements to install and run WHEAT include:

  • Microsoft (MS) Windows XP, Windows Vista, or Windows 7
  • Microsoft Excel 2007 or later to enable viewing of the WHEAT output reports. If you have Excel 2003, you can install the Microsoft compatibility pack to enable report viewing (see step 5 below)
  • A screen resolution of 1024 X 768 or higher
  • At least 150 MB of free hard drive space and 1 GB of RAM
  • Installation on your local drive (it cannot be installed on a network drive)
  • Internet connection

Top of Page

To install WHEAT:

  1. Double-click on the file "wheat3.exe" to start the setup wizard.
  2. Follow the prompts and click "Next" to move to the next screen in the wizard.
  3. The second screen will prompt the user to install WHEAT in the default location "C:\Program Files\WHEAT." This location can be changed (for instance, if the local drive is partitioned and is assigned a different letter), but the location cannot be changed to a network drive.
  4. Continue through the wizard and click "Install."
  5. After the installation, the wizard will alert users to the need to install MS Office Compatibility PackExitif the user has a version of MS Excel prior to 2007. The compatibility pack must be installed prior to viewing output reports, but does not need to be installed immediately after WHEAT installation. The compatibility pack is available from Microsoft.Exit

Top of Page
item.dc:creator: nthomas

item.title: Conduct a Drinking Water or Wastewater Utility Risk Assessment
item.description:
Vulnerability Self-Assessment Tool (VSAT) 6.0

Drinking water and wastewater utilities of all sizes can use VSAT to enhance their security and resiliency. Utilities can:

  • Identify the highest risks to mission-critical operations
  • Find the most cost-effective measures to reduce those risks    

VSAT Version 6.0 complies with the water sector risk assessment standard and can offer liability protection under the Department of Homeland Security’s Support Anti-Terrorism by Fostering Effective Technologies (SAFETY) Act program. EPA strongly encourages drinking water and wastewater utility owners and operators to use VSAT 6.0 to conduct or update an all-hazards risk assessment.

 

VSAT 6.0 Training Videos
Basic Advanced
  • Basic 1: Overview and Select Utility Assets                         
  • Basic 2: Countermeasures & Threats
  • Basic 3: Setup & Finish
  • Basic 4: Refining Analysis File
  • Basic 5A: Baseline Analysis–Consequence & Resilience Evaluation
  • Basic 5B: Baseline Analysis – Likelihood of Threat & Damage
  • Basic 6A: Improvement Analysis–Consequence Countermeasures
  • Basic 6B: Improvement Analysis–Reassess Consequence & Likelihood
  • Basic 7: Countermeasure Packages
  • Basic 8: Adding Potential Countermeasure Cost Information
  • Basic 9: Results & Reports Advanced Training
  • Advanced 1: Overview & Setup
  • Advanced 2: Asset Overview
  • Advanced 3: Asset Prioritization
  • Advanced 4: Countermeasures Overview & Selection
  • Advanced 5: Make & Edit Countermeasure Assignments
  • Advanced 6: Threats Overview & Threat Selection
  • Advanced 7: My Threats & Threat Assignment
  • Advanced 8: Baseline Analysis Overview
  • Advanced 9: Baseline Analysis Wizard
  • Advanced 10: Improvement Analysis Overview
  • Advanced 11: Re-evaluate Consequences
  • Advanced 12: Re-evaluate Likelihood of Damage
  • Advanced 13: Countermeasure Packages
  • Advanced 14: Cost/Risk Summary & Countermeasure Package Reports
  • Advanced 15: Review Results
  • Advanced 16: Generate Reports

item.title: Contact Us About Water Utility Risk Assessment Tools
item.description:
Report a Violation

Report possible violations of environmental laws and regulations.

Are you looking for answers to drinking water questions?

Take a look at our Questions & Answers database.

Do you have a comment or a drinking water question?

Please use our online form to send us comments or questions. Be sure to include your e-mail address to receive a response.
Note: If your comment is related to a specific web page, please include the link or URL.

Please use the form below to send us comments or questions. Be sure to include your e-mail address if you’d like a response.

Mailing Address:

U.S. EPA Office of Ground Water and Drinking Water
Water Security Division
Mail Code 4608T
1200 Pennsylvania Ave NW
Washington, DC 20460
